definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]

sentences.english: But truth is, many of us need a little help.
sentences.chinese: 但事實上，許多人都需要一點幫助來防微杜漸。

sentences.english: How can teenagers keep away from tobacco?Should adults be banned from smoking as well?
sentences.chinese: 作爲青少年，我們怎樣才能遠離吸菸人羣，防微杜漸？

sentences.english: The government and the media should take immediate actions to combat this issue.
sentences.chinese: 因此政府和媒體要及時採取措施，防微杜漸。

definition: to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
(idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1
